recipes.label: Market: Browsing and Shopping
recipes.startdescription: They sell a bag of fish the taverner just caught this morning and has a cheerful chat with the buyer. They then go to buy some flour and salt.
recipes.description: They are attracted by exotic-looking merchants, who sell dried lamb and exotic herbs. They poke their head into the crowd to get a closer look, but is disappointed by the price. "Dishonest merchants." They mutter under their breath.

recipes.label: Market: Observer
recipes.description: The scribe observes the market with ever-sharpening eyes. Observer +1.

recipes.label: Market: Observer

recipes.startdescription: They weave through stalls selling fruits and fresh cheese, stuffing a dried plum into the mouth as they go by.
recipes.description: They navigate the lively market, sniffing fresh cheese and oats. After seeing a new flower stand in the corner, they choose to buy a floral wreath for a certain someone.

recipes.label: Market: Browsing and Shopping
recipes.startdescription: It’s the Arbitrator’s Name Day. They wake up early to catch some fish and then go to the market. After exchanging fish for eggs, they approach the cheesemaker's stall. The Minstrel asks for a specific type of cheese, which they have never bought before.
recipes.description: They frown slightly upon hearing the cheese's price. They decide to leave the merchant and ask around, in order to ensure that they hadn't been deceived by a low-quality option. When they return, the merchant offers them a lower price. They happily take the deal.

recipes.label: Market: Browsing and Shopping
recipes.startdescription: As they go to the market and ask about cups, the merchant intends to sell them the more expensive ones. The merchant boasts that the cups are made of pine woods, with better carvings, but they immediately see through the trickery - those cups are made of Yews, just from a different area.
recipes.description: After the fifth time they politely refuse the merchant, they start to become impatient. "Just sell me a dozen of the cheapest ones, please." Reluctantly, the merchant passes them the plain wooden cups.

recipes.label: Market: Browsing and Shopping
recipes.startdescription: The market is particularly crowded today. A circus has come into town and will perform later. They wonder if the Minstrel would like to watch it. They pass a monk selling indulgences before visiting the spice seller.
recipes.description: They are very careful in picking the right spices for a reasonable price, as they know that the spices seller is particularly cunning. On the way back, they see an exotic-looking fortune teller is surrounded by people, not far from the monk selling indulgences. Always finding such a scene amusing, they grin.
